title: Intergovernmental Agreement (IGA) by/between Village's of Maywood, Broadview, Westchester and Hillside pertaining to NET 17 Radio System (Village Of Bellwood)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Intergovernmental Agreement (IGA) by/between Village's of Maywood, Broadview, Westchester and Hillside pertaining to NET 17 Radio System (Village Of Bellwood)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please provide a current copy and past copies of Intergovernmental Agreements by and between the Village's of Maywood, Broadview, Westchester, and Hillside, pertaining to the Police Radio Network, commonly referred to as "NET 17".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Law Dog

title: Jean Sweeney Park Development Plan (City Clerk of Alameda)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Jean Sweeney Park Development Plan (City Clerk of Alameda)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All public records about development, records, plans, and information about the Jean Sweeney Open Space Park in Alameda, California. Please provide records from the period of January 1, 2010 through September 18, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Victoria Anderer

communications.subject: PRAs to the City of Alameda
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The City has received your three PRAs (23-454, 23-455, and 23-456).  All three PRAs request the same documents.  Two of the PRAs (23-454 and 23-456) request the same documents from the same departments.  I am going to close PRA 23-456 as it is duplicative.  I am going to add Public Works to PRA 23-454 and close PRA 23-455 as it is duplicative.

All three PRAs have sent messages to you via NextRequest regarding these PRAs being over broad and requesting guidance.

The Public Records Act and related Sunshine Ordinance provisions ("PRA") provide timeframes to determine whether a request seeks disclosable records. (Gov. Code, § 7922.535.)

The PRA contains no specific time limits for producing disclosable records. Instead, it requires agencies to provide an estimate of the date the records will be made available. (Ibid.)  This is because the PRA recognizes that governmental operations should not come to halt in order for the public agency to respond to PRA requests, particularly requests for voluminous document sets. (See, e.g., Rogers v. Superior Court (1993) 19 Cal.App.4th 469, 483 [finding that request for production of records of 1990 convention in April and May of 1992 was timely].)

Due to the City's limited resources, the voluminous number for records responsive to the current PRA, and the current volume of PRA requests, at this time we anticipate that documents responsive to your request will be made available in approximately four (4) months or by February 1, 2024. If the documents become available before then, we will update you at that time.

Should you narrow your request, the time for production may be reduced.

Thank you, Lisa

Lisa K. Cooper
Administrative Services Coordinator
City of Alameda
2263 Santa Clara Avenue, Room #280
Alameda, CA 94501
(510) 747-4764
lcooper@alamedacityattorney.org<mailto:lcooper@alamedacityattorney.org>
*******************************************************************
Confidentiality Notice: This e-mail message, including any attachments, is sent by the Office of the City Attorney for the City of Alameda.  It is being sent for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail, delete the message and any attachments and destroy hard copies, if any, of the original message and attachments. Thank you.
*******************************************************************

title: National Guard Deployments to Southern Border (Arizona Army National Guard)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: National Guard Deployments to Southern Border (Arizona Army National Guard)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The number of National Guard troops stationed at the Southern Border, by month, from 2000 to June 2023. If possible, I would like data at the border sector level. Otherwise, data at the state level will be sufficient.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Heather Bone

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Records Request  - [UNCLASSIFIED - 2023-11-01T17:03:47.443Z]
communications.communication:
UNCLASSIFIED
Good morning,

I received your letter requesting records of National Guard troops.  I apologize for the delay as it went to the wrong office.  Any military records request must be made through the FOIA process at FOIA.gov - Freedom of Information Act<https://www.foia.gov/>.  For specific border related data, the CBP would be the best route to go through.

To clarify are you looking for specific hard copy records or just the number of troops that were activated on the various border missions from 2000 to 2023?

Respectfully,

CPT Erin Hannigan
Director of Communications
Arizona National Guard
Department of Emergency and Military Affairs, DEMA
Erin.c.hannigan3.mil@army.mil<mailto:Erin.c.hannigan3.mil@army.mil>

communications.communication: Just the number of troops, if possible broken down by CBP Border Patrol sector (https://www.cbp.gov/border-security/along-us-borders/border-patrol-sectors)

Good afternoon,

I was able to locate the numbers you were looking for.  From 2000- June 2023 we have had just over 4,000 service members mobilized in support of border operations in Title-10, Title-32 and State Active-Duty statues.  I cannot break it down per section but suggest reaching out to CBP for additional information.

Respectfully,

CPT Erin Hannigan

title: Wylie ISD Database Request

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Wylie ISD Database Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Title and Copy List of the district's library catalog including all titles, authors, ISBN and copy information (example copies/location). 

Note: This information can generally be easily retrieved by a district level user of Follett using the Generate a Title & Copy List Report (Library Manager) feature of the Follett catalogue. Instructions are attached and  located here https://legacyhelp.fsc.follett.com/content/t_generate_title_copy_list_report.htm. Please include all titles (regardless of status) and include the categories and circulation statistics. 

Please output the file(s) as Excel.

In the event the report is limited by the 10,000 title limit, please split it the catalogue information into multiple groupings as the report allows. For instance you could limit the titles in each file by selecting groupings A-G and H-Z.

As censorship is at an all time high, we are conducting research on titles that may be most at risk of censorship across Texas. We hope to assist schools in their mission of maintaining young learners critical access to books in their libraries.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities. I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the Internet Archive and MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

Additionally, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the released information to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.

Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category. As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sidney Braveword

title: Public Records Request: Violent Crime Intervention Fund

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: Violent Crime Intervention Fund
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to documents released by the State of Tennessee, the Anderson County Sheriff received $210,086 in funding awarded in 2022 from the Violent Crime Intervention Fund: https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/finance/ocjp/VCIF%20Funding%20Plan.pdf

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents related to the $210,086 received as part of the 2022 Violent Crime Intervention Fund.  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

communications.subject: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I am in receipt of the attached document.

For your convenience, I am including a link for Anderson County Government's Public Records Policy (Policy). https://andersoncountytn.gov/humanresources/public-records-request/ . Please find the County's fillable request form here<https://andersoncountytn.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Records-Request-Form.pdf>. Once completed, please forward to this email address for processing.

There are a few items that are found helpful in the facilitation of your request. Please pay close attention to No. 2 and 4. Proof of TN residency must be provided for the requestor. Please make certain you complete No. 4 in full (i.e. specify if you are waiving inspection). Additionally, if you wish to place a monetary limit less than specified on page 7, VI, G of the Policy ($100), please let me know. If you prefer your request response be submitted in a specific form (i.e. electronic, paper, etc.), if applicable, please specify on No. 3 or within this email. Lastly please include all contact information and include the desired form of communication on number 3.

Sincerely,
Kim

Kim Jeffers-Whitaker, SCP
Pronouns: She | Her | Hers
Director of Human Resource & Risk Management
Anderson County Government
100 N Main St., Room 102
Clinton, TN 37716
Main Tel 865.264.6300<tel:865.264.6300>  |  Direct 865.264.6330<tel:865.264.6330>  |  Fax 865.264.6259<tel:865.264.6259>  |  Cell 865.363.6321

title: Brandon Nodier Police Investigative Report

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Brandon Nodier Police Investigative Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Police reports, investigative records and arrest report for Brandon Nodier, date of birth January 1 1954, arrested in April 2012 at the St. Bernard Sheriff's Office in Chalmette and charged with the murder of Dorothy Thompson, 63, on May 2, 1985.
I understand the Parish Government does not maintain police reports, but I have been unable to get a response from the Sheriff’s Office by telephone, and there is no email address listed on the website. I hope you can help me.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mikita Brottman

communications.subject: RE: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Brandon Nodier Police Investigative Report
communications.communication:
Hello,
I have received your email, I will forward it to the St. Bernard Parish Sheriff’s Office they can also be reached at 504-271-2501 they may be able to give you a contact person for the information your requesting.
Thanks,
Donna Lopez
St. Bernard Parish Government
8201 W. Judge Perez Drive
Chalmette, La.  70043
504-278-4200
Ext. 1219

I am the attorney for the St. Bernard Parish Sheriff's Office.  Your public records request was just forwarded to my office today.  I have begun the process of  identifying and gathering the records requested which will have to be reviewed in order to determine whether any of the records requested are exempt from disclosure or is not a public record
I estimate this process will take approximately one week.
Thanks,Mary Hand504-277-7755

Our office has received several requests for the Brandon Nodier arrest
reports. According to our attorney's office, the request was fulfilled on
June 26, 2023 with a response that your office has received the request. Is
there more information being requested pertaining to your letter? The
letters being received are just an update from the May 25, 2023 letter,
which according to our records has been fulfilled.

Thank you,
Sgt. Shannon Cooper
St. Bernard Sheriff's Office
Criminal Records Division
Office - 504-278-7726
Fax - 504-278-7796

sensitive in nature as well as sensitive but unclassified and/or legally
privileged information. It is not to be released to the media, the general
public, or to non-law enforcement personnel who do not have a
"need-to-know".  This information is not to be posted on the Internet, or
disseminated through unsecured channels, and is intended for law
enforcement personnel only. It is solely for the use of the intended
recipient(s). Unauthorized interception, review, use or disclosure is
prohibited and may violate applicable laws including the Electronic
Communications Privacy Act. If you are not the intended recipient, please

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the
following records:

Police reports, investigative records and arrest report for Brandon Nodier,
date of birth January 1 1954, arrested in April 2012 at the St. Bernard
Sheriff's Office in Chalmette and charged with the murder of Dorothy
Thompson, 63, on May 2, 1985.
I understand the Parish Government does not maintain police reports, but I
have been unable to get a response from the Sheriff’s Office by telephone,
and there is no email address listed on the website. I hope you can help me.

this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer
the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or
CD-ROM if not.

look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business
days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mikita Brottman

title: Paul Laxalt

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Paul Laxalt
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The files of Paul Laxalt (1922-1918), former Nevada governor and US Senator, whose obituary is published here:

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/06/obituaries/paul-laxalt.html?rref=collection%2Fsectioncollection%2Fobituaries&action=click&contentCollection=obituaries&region=rank&module=package&version=highlights&contentPlacement=9&pgtype=sectionfront

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ryan Weisensee

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1413411-000
communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2023-ICFO-08197
communications.communication:
04/06/2023RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-08197        Dear Requester:ICE's final response to your FOIA request, 2023-ICFO-08197, for records pertaining to Paul Laxalt is attached.Please note that the attachment may be password protected. If you are prompted to enter a password when opening the attachment and you did not receive a password it may be in your junk/spam folder. Sincerely,ICE FOIA OfficeImmigration and Customs EnforcementFreedom of Information Act Office500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009Washington, D.C. 20536-5009 
This message (including any attachments) contains confidential information intended for a specific individual and purpose, and is protected by law. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and any disclosure, copying, or distribution
 of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited. 
Deloitte refers to a Deloitte member firm, one of its related entities, or Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited ("DTTL"). Each Deloitte member firm is a separate legal entity and a member of DTTL. DTTL does not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about
 to learn more.

title: Truleo Contracts (Torrance Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Truleo Contracts (Torrance Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Contracts, agreements, invoices, and any supporting documentation related to the use of applications named or provided by Truleo.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mitchell Kotler

title: Threats over LGTBQ+ meetings, events

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Threats over LGTBQ+ meetings, events
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. The "hate-filled emails regarding the district’s Day of Silence" referenced in the District's "Update Regarding 'The Prom' Musical" available here: https://www.d300.org/site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=2649&ViewID=dc687af4-502e-40ec-afcc-878bbf4f560b&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=22684&PageID=1&mibextid=Zxz2cZ&fbclid=IwAR2x6u2l17Qzv5yxTz2Df16WvGfGmVcKOrMIu4QCWsjs8WTZhlG1uF0t11k

2. The "threats and inappropriate comments from community members related to our LGBTQ+ Learning Space meeting held at a District 300 school" referenced in the "Update" above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Your D300 FOIA inquiry - Extension Letter - Our record #155-2023
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Steinbaugh, 
  
 I am responding to your October 31, request(s) under the Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.), in which you asked for the below referenced information. The District is extending the response time for an additional five working days, until November 14, 2023 for the following reason(s), as permitted by Subsection 3(e) of the Act: 
  
 (vi) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by paragraph (c) of this Section without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body. 
  
 FOIA Request: Requesting the following records: 1. The "hate-filled emails regarding the district’s Day of Silence" referenced in the District's "Update Regarding 'The Prom' Musical" available here: http://url4102.request.justfoia.com/ls/click?upn=XfJvxk0gd1RbNAoCtqw15pfAd2lZqYyl4QFbveRaGLs-3DTYFY_OHYlYl8BwCFh9pXOctmIU-2F1TKSb3DA-2BGl6oPkU51c-2F2COpmt5Tdd2VM683q3EJl6p4A2oUmjqtVcwCg2C9xWuv9HFPpiSVHRpgjGrUXup281dPig-2FiqwDIK72WGZn-2Btknd-2F1zOkN4mC3yECh84UVKAQcSLhRLfBqsRel8C6KP3oeRoB28Y0x40T8ifb3sRUfogf7mJz3dfxmGu-2FsNgVJ4pqzLuuEWFmfGEt7onbfJfE5txVgIPweb5WZKIQxgcXQQf1UXJ0A49ESMoMPmxmjxk7a5aetYvuSrj4vnYQNYAz6VTJFjmxakLMTOTsFMb6FaWTfv7kN-2BopEk2A-2ByzwanQ-3D-3D (full link provided). 2. communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #FOIL-2023-810-04801
communications.communication:
Ok, I am not that happy about that date, but if the DOB will actually produce documents on that date, I may accept it.

My prior experience with the city involves agencies repeatedly declaring that documents will be furnished by a specific date 60 days in the future, only to (on that date) again delay it by 60 days. Will the DOB commit to releasing records by Wednesday, February 14, 2024? I will not hesitate to appeal on basis of constructive denial should that date be missed.

communications.communication:
Hi,

For the above FOIL, a message was sent to you asking for more information.

Hi,

For the above, the information for the request was posted in the portal on April 19, 2021:

The Department of Buildings ("DOB") is in receipt of your FOIL Request no. 2020-810-03664 regarding COVID-19 Testing Data ("FOIL Request") dated November 1, 2020. DOB now provides the following responses:

The "list" mentioned by one of your employees in widely viral incident in a yeshiva, in which the employee stated, on or about October 26, 2020, that she was given a list
Regarding religious institutions/schools. The video can be viewed at https://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/featured/1913743/shock-video-out-of-controlnyc-
health-dept-inspectors-visit-empty-yeshiva-start-writing-summonses.html, and the admission of a list can be seen at 1:39.

Request denied. DOB has no material that is responsive to request no. 1. Please note the link that you have provided states that the persons shown in the video are "nyc-health-dept-inspectors."

All directives, guidances, correspondence, memoranda, and all other records regarding COVID-19-related enforcement in the Jewish communities in Kings County September 1, 2020 through October 30, 2020;

Request denied. DOB has no material that is responsive to request no. 2. Per New York State Public Officers Law sec.89 (3) (a), request no. 2 fails to "reasonably describe" a record that DOB maintains.

All data, notes, correspondence, memoranda, final documents and other related records relating to COVID-19 testing in the zip codes 11204, 11210, 11219, 11229, and 11230 that were/are being sent to the Mayor's Office, NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene or another city agency from September 1, 2020 through October 30, 2020;

Request denied. DOB has no material that is responsive to request no. 9.

All data, notes, memoranda, and final documents relating to CoVID-19 testing in the zip codes 11204, 11210, 11219, 11229, and 11230 that were/are being sent to the Governor's Office or from the Governor's office to NYS Department of Health or another state agency from September 1, 2020 through October 30, 2020.

Request denied. DOB is not included among the agencies listed in request no. 10 and has no material that is responsive to request no. 10.

Hi,

For the above FOIL, you got the attached documents.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #FOIL-2023-810-04800
communications.communication:
Ok, I am not that happy about that date, but if the DOB will actually produce documents on that date, I will accept it.

My prior experience with the city involves agencies repeatedly declaring that documents will be furnished by a specific date 60 days in the future, only to (on that date) again delay it by 60 days. Will the DOB commit to releasing records by Wednesday, February 14, 2024? I will not hesitate to appeal on basis of constructive denial should that date be missed.

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2023-810-04800 Closed
communications.communication:
The Department of Buildings (DOB) has closed your FOIL request FOIL-2023-810-04800 for the following reasons: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2023-810-04800) 
Please submit your request for plans/drawings through DOB NOW.  A copy of DOB's Service Notice dated November 16, 2021, was sent to you in the previous email, along with DOB NOW Public Portal & Jobs/Filings link. 
To request plans, you must first create an e-Filing Account with the Department and then file an official record request online through the Public Portal. Once our records room team finds the requested documents, they will reach out to inform you they are ready for pick up at the Borough Office. DOB has created a guide with additional information on how to request records using the Public Portal. 
 
You may appeal the decision to deny access to material that was redacted in part or withheld in entirety by contacting the agency’s FOIL Appeals Officer: dglikin@buildings.nyc.gov, within 30 days of the date of this letter.

title: Cosimo Di Lauro (December 8, 1973 – June 13, 2022)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Cosimo Di Lauro (December 8, 1973 – June 13, 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The results of a search of the NADDIS pointer index for the Investigative Reporting and Filing System, for the name and identifying information of Cosimo Di Lauro, a drug trafficker based in Naples, Italy. 

He was a member of the Neopolitan organized crime group (or "mafia") commonly called the Camorra.

Di Lauro's death has been widely reported (see attachment in PDF) and privacy concerns recognized under FOIA and Privacy Act are diminished post-mortem. Records are releasable in the public interest, due to Martinez's notoriety as a high-level dealer as part of a known Drug Trafficking Organization. 

To identify records, the following information is known about Di Lauro:

Full name: Cosimo Di Lauro
Nickname: o' Chiatto
Date of Birth: December 8, 1973
Date of Death: June 13, 2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.subject: FOIA request (case 24-00003-FR)
communications.communication:
Dear T. McElwee,

Pursuant to you recent FOIA request (case 24-00003-FR), I will be forwarding our final determination response via email. We have determined that some of the records contain sensitive information that requires encryption as explained below.

In an effort to better protect information that the Department of Justice (DOJ) maintains about individuals, we have implemented a tool to prevent accidental disclosures of sensitive personally identifiable information (PII). Documents that are responsive to a FOIA or Privacy Act request may contain sensitive PII. To safeguard this information, any email containing sensitive PII will be encrypted. Accordingly, you may receive an alert that that an encrypted message has been delivered to you. Should you receive such an alert, please use the attached instruction to decrypt and save the message. If you have any issues with this process, please reply with the error message received so that we may contact our service desk for support.

V/R
Jason T. Miller
FOIA Analyst II
Freedom of Information and Privacy Act Unit
FOIA and Information Law Section
Drug Enforcement Administration
Desk: (571) 776-3436
Email: Jason.T.Miller2@dea.gov<mailto:Jason.T.Miller2@dea.gov>

[https://intranet13.shpt.sbu.dea.doj.gov/sites/cp/PublishingImages/Pages/DEA-50th-Anniversary-News/50th%20Anniversary%20Email%20Signature%20Block_329x83.png]

PRIVACY ACT NOTICE:  This e-mail (including any attachments herein) may contain personal and privileged information that requires protection in compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a).  Any use of this information by anyone other than the intended recipient is prohibited.  If you have received this communication in error, please immediately delete all copies of this information and notify me by e-mail.  The use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this communication by unintended recipients is not authorized and may be unlawful

title: Crime Free Housing Program and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Crime Free Housing Program and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (July 2021-July 2023) regarding "crime-free" housing and nuisance property ordinances that will be referred to as “program” and "ordinance" respectively, in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as “Crime Free Housing Program” and "Nuisance Creating Behaviors" as described in Modesto's Code of Ordinances Chapter 12 Article 3.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program and Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the program and ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance or program

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance and program

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the program and ordinance

• all documents concerning the passage of the nuisance ordinance and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the nuisance ordinance since July 2021 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Your City of Modesto CA public records request #23-499 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Modesto CA ************************************************************************ Your record request #23-499 has been submitted successfully. Please be advised that City of Modesto has received your California Public Records Act request. Your request will be processed in compliance with the Public Records Act. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, the City shall, within 10 days from receipt of the request, determine whether the request, in whole or in part, will be made available and shall promptly notify the person making the request of the determination and the reasons therefore. In certain circumstances, the time limit prescribed in this section may be extended by written notice to the person making the request, setting forth the reasons for the extension and the date on which a determination is expected to be dispatched. Please note that you will be contacted when the information is available. All document duplication fees are due and payable in full and are based on the City’s current fee resolution. As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the City of Modesto CA portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the City of Modesto CA through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Modesto CA.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City of Modesto CA public records request #23-499
communications.communication:
City of Modesto CA ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-499: Dear Requester, This email is in response to your written request for public records received by the City. We are treating your request as a request for public records in accordance with California Government Code Section 7920.000 and following (the California Public Records Act, or “the Act”). The Act requires that public agencies make reasonably identified, non-exempt public records available for inspection or provide copies upon payment of the direct costs of duplication. The City is required to notify you within ten (10) days whether the requested records will be disclosed. (Gov. Code section 7922.535(a)). On August 14th, the City notified you that we would need an additional 14 days to respond pursuant to Government Code section 7922.535(b). This response fulfills the City’s obligations under the Act. Responsive, non-exempt public records have been recovered and will be provided as soon as possible, after review by the City Attorney’s Office. Once the review has been completed the City will release those documents in a rolling release. When the City makes those responsive records available to you, it will redact all information determined to be privileged or exempt from disclosure under the CPRA or other applicable law. These redactions will include, but not be limited to: (i) Government Code section 7927.700, 7927.705 (incorporating privacy exemptions found in the United States Constitution and Article 1, section 1 of the California Constitution), which exempts certain private information from disclosure where the release of such records would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy; (ii) Government code section 7927.500, which allows for “preliminary drafts, notes, or interagency or intra-agency memoranda that are not retained…in the ordinary course of business” to be withheld when the public interest in withholding the records clearly outweighs the public interest in disclosure; (iii) Government Code Section 7922.000 “deliberative process privilege,” implied by California courts from the “public interest exception.” Under this exemption, records containing information which could expose the public agency’s decision making process in such a way as to discourage candid discussion within the agency and undermine its ability to perform its functions are exempt from disclosure; (iv) provisions of the Evidence Code related to privilege.” (Gov. Code § 7927.705.) This provision incorporates records subject to Evidence Code section 954, which exempts lawyer-client communications from disclosure. Government Code section 7927.705also incorporates records subject to Code of Civil Procedure sections 2018.010 through 2018.030, which exempt attorney work product from disclosure. Records responsive to your request are being withheld according to these exemptions. Additionally, records responsive to your request are being withheld according to Government Code section 7927.200, which exempts from disclosure records pertaining to pending litigation or to claims made under the Government Claims Act until the pending litigation or claim has been finally adjudicated or settled; (v) Government Code section 7922.000 or “catch-all exemption”, which exempts records from disclosure where the public interest in nondisclosure clearly outweighs the public interest in disclosure. The first batch will be released on or before September 21st. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Modesto CA.
Technical support: See our help page

Government Code section 7927.705also incorporates records subject to Code of Civil Procedure sections 2018.010 through 2018.030, which exempt attorney work product from disclosure. Records responsive to your request are being withheld according to these exemptions. Additionally, records responsive to your request are being withheld according to Government Code section 7927.200, which exempts from disclosure records pertaining to pending litigation or to claims made under the Government Claims Act until the pending litigation or claim has been finally adjudicated or settled; (v) Government Code section 7922.000 or “catch-all exemption”, which exempts records from disclosure where the public interest in nondisclosure clearly outweighs the public interest in disclosure. communications.subject: Auto Reply
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act (PRA) request.  Your request will be reviewed and the appropriate departments contacted to determine if disclosable records relevant to your request exist.

As required under California Code section 7922.535(a), the Los Angeles Unified School District (District) will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available.  There is no requirement for a public agency to actually produce the records within 10 days of receiving a request, unless the requested records are readily available.  Still, the District prides itself on always providing all publicly disclosable records in as timely a manner as possible.

Should you have any questions, please contact the Office of the General Counsel at (213) 241-7600.

Thank you.

PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL.

communications.subject: PRA Request - MuckRock #25 - 6.22.2023 - OGC Ctrl # 0078433
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act request in which you requested various records as outlined in the attached request.

Pursuant to California Government Code section 7922.535, the District is permitted to extend the date for responding under the following specified circumstances:

1.            The District needs to search for and collect the requested records from field facilities or other establishments that are separate from the office processing the request.
2.            The District needs to search for, collect and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records that are demanded in the request.
3.            The District may need to consult, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with two or more components of the agency having substantial subject matter interest therein.
4.            The District may need to compile data.

In this regard, an extension is needed regarding the above-highlighted number(s).  The District will respond to your request no later than the close of business on July 17, 2023, with an estimated date and time that responsive documents will be made available.

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at (213) 241-7600.  Please refer to the following reference number in any correspondence regarding this request: # 0078433.

Thank you.


[A blue and red logo  Description automatically generated with low confidence]

Natalie Ann Johnson
Paralegal
Office of the General Counsel
Los Angeles Unified School District

communications.subject: Production - PRA Request - MuckRock #25 - 6.22.2023 - OGC Ctrl # 0078433
communications.communication:
Hello,

Your request has been reviewed and pursuant to California Government Code section(s) 7920.000 - 7931.000, the District will produce copies of responsive records. Any information withheld and/or redactions applied to these records were done so pursuant to Government Code section(s) 7922.000.

After conducting a thorough search of our records, we determined the following for each request:



  1.  A list of all LAUSD facilities After Hours licenses for the years 2005-2006.
Records responsive to this Request are attached and numbered LAUSD PRA - 1 to LAUSD PRA - 16.


  1.  A list of all LAUSD facilities After Hours licenses for the years 2022-2023.
Records responsive to this Request are attached and numbered LAUSD PRA - 17 to LAUSD PRA - 27.


  1.  A list of all LAUSD facilities After Hours Permits.
Records responsive to this Request are attached and numbered LAUSD PRA - 28 to LAUSD PRA - 33.

With the production of these records, we are concluding this matter, and closing our file.

Thank you for contacting the Los Angeles Unified School District Public Records Act Unit.

Best,

title: Request: Access to Records - Rachel Martinez Arrest (Trinidad Police Department)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Request: Access to Records - Rachel Martinez Arrest (Trinidad Police Department)
communications.communication:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: July 8, 2023

Trinidad Police Department
204 E. Main Street
Trinidad, CO 81082

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Request for Records

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of the following records held by the Trinidad Police Department pertaining to the arrest of Rachel Martinez on July 6, 2023, in Trinidad, CO:

Body-worn camera (BWC) footage: I request copies of all available body-worn camera footage recorded by the officers involved in the arrest of Rachel Martinez. This request is supported by relevant case law, including: Citing North Jersey Media Group Inc. v. Township of Lyndhurst, 229 N.J. 541 (2017) and Wood v. Moss, 572 U.S. 744 (2014).

Dashcam footage: I request copies of all available dashcam footage recorded by the patrol vehicles involved in the arrest of Rachel Martinez. This request is supported by relevant case law, including: Citing Ctr. for Pub. Integrity v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 846 F.3d 1238 (D.C. Cir. 2017) and Slocum v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 228 F. Supp. 3d 34 (D.D.C. 2017).

Arrest report: I request a copy of the arrest report, including all relevant details and information related to the charges of Criminal Mischief and Resisting Arrest. This request is supported by relevant case law, including: Citing New York Times Co. v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 915 F.3d 508 (2d Cir. 2019) and Ctr. for Investigative Reporting v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 746 F.3d 1088 (9th Cir. 2014).

911 audio recordings: I request copies of any audio recordings of the 911 call(s) or dispatch communications related to the incident involving Rachel Martinez. This request is supported by relevant case law, including: Citing Associated Press v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 549 F.3d 62 (2d Cir. 2008) and Soucie v. David, 448 F.2d 1067 (D.C. Cir. 1971).

Booking records: I request copies of the booking records for Rachel Martinez, including any photographs or mugshots taken during the booking process. This request is supported by relevant case law, including: Citing Dettelbach v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 745 F.3d 449 (6th Cir. 2014) and Associated Press v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 549 F.3d 62 (2d Cir. 2008).

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.

If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: +1 845-218-0299

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

title: Open Records Request: Grants

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Grants
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

On March 24, 2023, the State of New Jersey Office of the Attorney General issued a press release stating: "AG Platkin Announces 20 NJ Law Enforcement Agencies to Receive Grants Totaling $7 Million for Technology to Combat Gun Violence." (https://www.njoag.gov/ag-platkin-announces-20-nj-law-enforcement-agencies-to-receive-grants-totaling-7-million-for-technology-to-combat-gun-violence/)

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents for the $7 million in grants awarded to 20 law enforcement agencies across New Jersey by the Office of Attorney General, Department of Law and Public Safety. As named in the press release above, the following are the list of grantees: 

City of Atlantic City, Atlantic County – $333,700
Bergen County Sheriff’s Office, Bergen County – $336,500
Burlington County Prosecutor’s Office, Burlington County – $200,000
Township of Pemberton, Burlington County – $167,850
Willingboro Police Department, Burlington County – $99,000
Camden County Police Department, Camden County – $164,000
Township of Winslow, Camden County – $285,452
East Orange Police Department, Essex County – $105,500
City of Newark Department of Public Safety, Essex County – $1,019,418 
City of Orange, Essex County – $108,500
Mercer County Prosecutor’s Office, Mercer County – $567,400
Edison Police Department, Middlesex County – $40,902
County of Monmouth, Monmouth County – $20,000
Paterson Police Department, Passaic County – $276,108
Salem County Prosecutor’s Office, Salem County – $148,500
Franklin Township Police Department, Somerset County – $339,500
County of Union, Union County – $150,000
Union County Police Department, Union County – $355,500
Phillipsburg Police Department, Warren County – $297,000
New Jersey State Police – $1,985,671

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Government Records Request - W205874
communications.communication:
The Office of the Attorney General is in receipt of your request for records related to the funding awards to law enforcement agencies for technology to combat gun violence.

In response to your request, I am providing you with the applications, and, to the extent they have been executed, the awards for the following 16 agencies: Atlantic City, Bergen County, Burlington County, Camden County, Edison, Mercer County Prosecutor's Office, Monmouth County Prosecutor's Office, Newark, NJ State Police, Orange, Pemberton, Philipsburg, Salem County Prosecutor's Office, Union County Police, Union County Prosecutor's Office Willingboro, and Winslow.  Please note that Monmouth County Prosecutor's Office did not proceed with accepting the funding.    Due to the volume of records, the files have been made available at the following link: https://njoag.box.com/s/fsvt9trzjyf6qzmkkgfu2w2m4sx9j4ga

The remaining applicants' records (Franklin, East Orange, and Paterson) are still under review and an extension to November 13th is required.



Ivonnely Colon-Fung, Deputy Attorney General
Law & Public Safety - OAG Custodian of Records
Richard J. Hughes Justice Complex

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Lake Jackson Texas Police - Arrest of Rolando Reyes by Officer Johnny Cagle and Officer Mendoza - Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) A copy of the Incident Report associated with the arrest of Rolando Reyes on or about March 4, 2022

2) A copy of the Use of Force Report associated with the arrest of Rolando Reyes on or about March 4, 2022

3) A copy of any Citation issued with the arrest of Rolando Reyes on or about March 4, 2022

4) A copy of any Supplemental  Report associated with the arrest of Rolando Reyes on or about March 4, 2022

Excluded from this request:

a) Confidential information deemed protected by Texas Law, Statute or Attorney General Ruling.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stuart Martin

title: Education for ICE detainees

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Education for ICE detainees
communications.communication:
July 11, 2023

Patrick C. Lee
General Counsel
Plymouth County Sheriff
24 Long Pond Road
Plymouth, MA 02360

Dear Mr. Lee, 

This is a request under the Massachusetts Public Record Law (M.G.L. Chapter 66, Section 10). I am requesting that I be provided a copy of the following records: 

1. Any policies or procedures that dictate what educational and programmatic services are offered to Federal Detainees and ICE Detainees within Plymouth Sheriff’s custody.

2. Records that indicate what educational services (including but not limited to K-12 education, Special Education, Vocational Education, High School Equivalency, or post-secondary education), if any, were provided to federal detainees and ICE detainees  from January 2021 through the date that this request is responded to. We request records that show the age of the detainee who received educational services, and the type of educational services provided. If no educational services were provided during this time, a statement to that effect would be appreciated.


The Public Records law requires you to provide me with a written response within 10 business days.  I would appreciate an electronic response via email.  Thank you, in advance.

Sincerely, 

Joshua Dankoff
Director of Strategic Initiatives
Citizens for Juvenile Justice
44 School St. Suite 415,
Boston, MA 02108
617-338-1050

title: Request to Navy for list of 2021 film collaborations (U.S. Navy)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Navy for list of 2021 film collaborations (U.S. Navy)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the U.S. Navy has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2021. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Navy assistance to production of 1996 film "The Rock" (U.S. Navy)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Navy assistance to production of 1996 film "The Rock" (U.S. Navy)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the United States Navy and the production of the 1996 movie "The Rock," directed by Michael Bay. I would like to know if the Navy provided any form of support or technical advice whatsoever to the production or to any member of the cast or crew, or if the production or any member of the cast or crew sought assistance from the Navy in connection with the production of the film.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Shotspotter Rollout Dates (Minneapolis Police Department)

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Shotspotter Rollout Dates (Minneapolis Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documentation that refers to the rollout dates of Shotspotter sensors in their respective district. In particular, I am looking for the dates in which Shotspotter became active in each police district.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michael Topper

communications.subject: OpenCity data request DR22_038977 - Your request has been resolved
communications.communication:
Hi 136921-61508056@requests.muckrock.com 
Contact us 
 This resolved request will remain under My Open Requests on the OpenCity Portal for two weeks. During that time, you may contact us regarding your request through the portal, or by replying to this email. 
 Closed requests After two weeks, your request will move to My Closed Requests on the OpenCity Portal. You will be able to see your request for 60 days; however, you will no longer be able to contact us regarding this request in the portal. Once your request is closed you will need to contact us at ResponsibleAuthority@minneapolismn.gov. You must include your reference number, and if possible, forward this email with your communication. We will respond to you as soon as we can. (mailto:ResponsibleAuthority@minneapolismn.gov) 
 Thank you, 
 OpenCity Data Practices Team ResponsibleAuthority@minneapolismn.gov (mailto:ResponsibleAuthority@minneapolismn.gov) Unsubscribe (https://minneapolis.service-now.com/opencityportal?id=unsubscribe) 
 
Ref:MSG6158477

 Public Comments: 
2023-11-13 11:46:05 CST - Katie Knudsen Public Comments 
Hello, 
Data responsive to your request have been released through the OpenCity portal. It can take up to 15 minutes for the data to appear. Please log in to your OpenCity account, click on My Requests and then select this reference number to view the available data. 
Data was redacted and/or withheld per Minnesota Statutes, Chapter 13: Government Data Practices–Sections 13.37. 
Minneapolis Police provided the additional information below: The ShotSpotter system went live on 3/19/2007 in both the 3rd and 4th Precincts. On, 9/19/2014, 8/5/2019 and 9/30/2019 there was an increase in coverage of the 4th Precinct. At this time, your request will be closed. Thank you, Katie Knudsen Enterprise Information Management Analyst City of Minneapolis – City Clerk’s Office katherine.knudsen@minneapolismn.gov (mailto:katherine.knudsen@minneapolismn.gov) she/her

title: FOIA Platforms

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Platforms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Agency’s request for proposal for FOIA platform and services, all bids submitted in response the to request for proposal, any statements of work submitted in connection to the request for proposal, and contract/agreement to provide the FOIA platform and services for the Agency. 

I am requesting this information on an expedited based for an article I am writing as a journalist about all agencies moving from FOIA Online to other platforms and services.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Davis

communications.subject: Thank you for submitting your foia.gov request
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting your FOIA request through FOIA.GOV to National Labor Relations Board! 
You can track the status of your request, communicate with the agency regarding this request, or search previously released documents in our reading room using the SecureRelease portal. If you do not already have a SecureRelease portal account you can sign-up (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) here, just make sure to use 153750-23850462@requests.muckrock.com when you sign up to gain access to your request details. (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) 

Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us, please email SecureRelease Support and a member of our team will be happy to assist. (https://www.securerelease.us/) 
 

Take care, 

 
SecureRelease™ Support (Contractor) 
securereleasepublicsupport@deloitte.com  Do NOT respond to this email. The SecureRelease™ Support desk is not operated by a FOIA Office or Agency personnel, and does not process requests--please do not send request details, supporting documentation, or other sensitive information to this inbox. Additionally, please note that SecureRelease™ Support is unable to provide updates concerning the processing, status, or timeline of requests, nor can we offer guidance with regard to agency procedures. For these inquiries, please contact the Agency or refer to their website.

communications.subject: Acknowledgment of FOIA Request (2024-NLFO-00164)
communications.communication:
10/27/2023Hannah Davisre: FOIA Request number: 2024-NLFO-00164Dear Hannah Davis:This is an acknowledgment of receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated 10/26/2023 submitted to the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) FOIA Branch and seeking records pertaining to "To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:The Agency’s request for proposal for FOIA platform and services, all bids submitted in response the to request for proposal, any statements of work submitted in connection to the request for proposal, and contract/agreement to provide the FOIA platform and services for the Agency.I am requesting this information on an expedited based for an article I am writing as a journalist about all agencies moving from FOIA Online to other platforms and services.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Hannah DavisWe have docketed your request as 2024-NLFO-00164.  Please use this request number in all future correspondence concerning this request.  The NLRB FOIA Branch processes FOIA requests on "first-in, first-out" basis. The actual processing time will depend on the complexity of the request and whether or not it involves sensitive or voluminous records, or extensive searches and/or consultations. Please visit our website at https://www.nlrb.gov/guidance/freedom-of-information-act-foia/foia-reference-guide for more information about the FOIA and the NLRB FOIA regulations. If you have any questions about the status of your request, please feel free to contact me, Joseph Mullaney at (202) 273-3863 or by e-mail at joseph.mullaney@nlrb.gov.Sincerely,Joseph MullaneyFOIA AttorneyFOIA BranchNational Labor Relations Board

communications.subject: Expedited Processing Granted (2024-NLFO-00164)
communications.communication:
10/27/2023Hannah Davisre: FOIA Request number: 2024-NLFO-00164Dear Hannah Davis:This is in response to your FOIA Request dated 10/26/2023, received by the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) FOIA Branch and docketed as 2024-NLFO-00164 in which you requested expedited processing of your request.You state that you are requesting expedited processing of your request for the following reason: "I am requesting this information on an expedited based for an article I am writing as a journalist about all agencies moving from FOIA Online to other platforms and services.".We have granted your request for expedited processing and will process your request on a "first-in, first-out" expedited basis. title: CMS CMMI Communications regarding the RO-APM

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CMS CMMI Communications regarding the RO-APM
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Email communications from the CMS Innovation Center regarding the Radiation Oncology Model ("RO Model" or "RO-APM") from January 1st, 2019 to December 31st, 2021. Specifically, communications regarding the model development to or from Dr. Mark Reardon (Quality Lead, RO Model), Marcie O’Reilly (Team Lead, RO Model), Genevieve Kehoe (Pricing Methodology Lead, RO Model), Dr. Aileen Chen (Clinical Consultant), the American Society for Radiation Oncology ("ASTRO"), and Mathematica Policy Research.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Bill Roentgen

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #090820227055
communications.communication:
Good morning -

I appreciate the consistency and effort this request took, this was a large number of emails on a complex topic.

I understand the redactions made through the FOIA exemptions, in particular, the (b)(6) redactions.

As is evident in the release, due to Exemption 5, the vast majority of this information is redacted (or was already publicly available).

Prior to filing an appeal, I would request consideration of the following:

1) On page 1258 of the PDF, while the email is from a CMS employee and appears to be exempt under (b)(5), it is actually a CMS employee forwarding an email she received from a member of the public on their opinion on interim information. As such, this would not fall under an exemption, as it is not a pre-decision opinion by CMS. Could this redaction be removed? This email is being forwarded by the CMS employee as an "FYI".

2) On page 234 of the PDF, an employee of CMS has received a copy from an outside organization of an article published in The Journal of Clinical Oncology (a journal and article available to the public). The (b)(5) redaction appears to be applied to the employees opinion on the article, not on internal decision making process. As the opinion is being rendered on a public document, and after contact initiated by an outside organization, could this redaction be removed?

After looking at the rest of the release, the other Exemption 5 redactions seem consistent, save for these two.

Again, I really appreciate this work. This was a huge number of files!

Thank you!

Control Number 090820227055 and PIN T3QD
