title: 1980s and 1990s Investigations in Dayton (Dayton Police Department)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: 1980s and 1990s Investigations in Dayton (Dayton Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am breaking this request into sub-requests that you may address individually:

1. I am seeking all records relating to the investigation into the murder of LAWRENCE E. HILEMAN at 626 OAK ST on or around September 15, 1988. These records should include investigative reports, interview transcripts, communications between police departments or federal investigative agencies, photographs, booking records or any other records associated to this incident. This incident is widely reported in the Dayton Daily News at this time.

2. I am seeking all records relating to ROGER W WALLER a former Dayton police officer who was charged in the murder of LAWRENCE E HILEMAN and was employed by the Dayton Police department at this time. Records should include any disciplinary records, records relating to internal affairs investigations of WALLER or any additional records relating to WALLER'S employment at your agency. Mr. WALLER's arrest was widely reported in the Dayton Daily News at this time.

3. I am seeking all records from 1980 through 1994 for your Drug Hot Line including incoming reports that were written, filed, or transmitted. As per the Dayton Daily News, Sunday February 18, 1990, Mr. WALLER operated this line.

4. I am seeking all records relating to LARRY GROSSNICKLE's employment at your department including disciplinary matters, internal affairs investigations or any other details relating to Mr. GROSSNICKLE's employment from 1980 through 1994. If Mr. GROSSNICKLE started his employment after 1980, please use his start date as the beginning of your record search.

5. I am seeking all records relating to DOYLE BURKE's employment at your department including disciplinary matters, internal affairs investigations or any other details relating to Mr. BURKE's employment from 1980 through 1994. If Mr. BURKE started his employment after 1980, please use his start date as the beginning of your record search.

6. I am seeking any and all records relating to WENDELL SCOTT SIMPSON including drug tip line tips, confidential information records, police interviews, booking records and photographs or street/gang intelligence reports relating to Mr. SIMPSON prior to his death.

I would ask that if you are discovering records that you release them to me in a rolling fashion as you discover them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Justin Seitz

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following West Virginia Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Sept. 12, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

I am in receipt of your FOIA Request dated September 12, 2023, in which you seek:

Any correspondence, electronic or written from or to AG employee Pam Krushansky with any of these keywords:
(WVFRW, West Virginia Federation of Republican Women, GOP, Republican, Jeani, Hawkins, Karen, Evans, Debbie, Deweese, Anne, Dandelet, Denise, Morrisey, Republican Women, campaign, election, vote, donation, Chris Miller, Mac Warner, Moore Capito)

We are in the process of conducting searches for potentially responsive public records.  However, in reviewing your request I do not see a date range in which you are seeking responsive records.  Please let me know what date range you are asking us to search within.  This will allow me to complete the search in a timely fashion.  Additionally, the inclusion of common names (i.e. Karen etc.) is likely to capture numerous communications that may or may not be relevant to your intended request.  To the extent you are able to provide more specific search terms it will aid in processing the request and reduce the volume of unrelated items that are pulled.  Finally, the inclusion of "Morrisey" as a search term will result in any emails or communications with the Attorney General's name in signature blocks.  Again, to the extent you are able to provide clarity on the information sought or let me know which search terms should be search in conjunction with each other, rather than each individually, it will aid in processing your request so that we are able to provide the information you are seeking.

Please feel free to email me at this address or call me at 304-558-1482 to discuss this matter at your convenience.

Once I have received the date range, and any other clarification, I will be able to provide you with a date our response will be provided.
Thanks,

Steven

Steven A. Travis
General Counsel
Office of the West Virginia Attorney General
State Capitol
Building 1, Rm. E-26
Charleston, WV 25305
(304)558-1482
Steven.A.Travis@wvago.gov<mailto:Steven.A.Travis@wvago.gov>

communications.subject: RE: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Pam Krushansky

title: HISD libraries (Houston Independent School District)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: HISD libraries (Houston Independent School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Recent news articles show HISD is eliminating 28 libraries and turning them into "Team Centers": https://www.click2houston.com/news/local/2023/07/26/hisd-to-eliminate-librarians-turn-libraries-into-discipline-centers-at-28-campuses/

Therefore, I request the following:

- Any emails (including attachments), memos, presentations, complaints, proposals, budgets, staffing plans, meeting notes or recordings, photos, or videos about or mentioning the plan to convert libraries into "Team Centers." Please specifically search for "Team Centers," but also include responsive records about Team Centers even if that name is not specifically used.

Please search from Jan 1, 2023 through the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

communications.subject: August 1, 2023 Request for Clarification (Koebler MN072823)
communications.communication:
Good morning,


Pursuant to Tex. Gov't. Code § 552.222(b), the District requires clarification and/or narrowing of your below open records request.



HISD is requesting the following information so that a search for documents may be conducted:



  *   For emails of HISD employees and officials, please provide the names of the HISD employees or officials whose emails are being requested.
  *   Specific search terms/key words to include in the search for emails.



Pursuant to §552.222(d) and (e) of the Government Code the District is required to provide you, the requestor, with the following information:  Your below request will be considered withdrawn by you, the requestor, if HISD does not receive a written response from you by the 61st day after the date this request for clarification was sent by HISD.


Your response to this request for clarification may be made by email, fax, or, regular address.  Contact information is as follows:

By email:
kelliso1@houstonisd.org<mailto:ledward8@houstonisd.org>
By Fax:
713-556-6061
By mail:
4400 West 18th Street
Public Information-Box 99
Houston, TX 77092



Please note that when a governmental entity, acting in good faith, requests clarification and/or narrowing of an unclear or overbroad request for public information, the deadlines under the Act are measured from the date the request is clarified and/or narrowed.  Finally, depending on the nature of your clarified and/or narrowed request for information, the District may be required to send you a cost estimate for charges associated with your clarified and/or narrowed request or seek an opinion from the Texas Attorney General regarding whether the District must release the responsive information to you.


Please let us know how you would like to proceed.  Thank you.

Katheryne

title: 2023: September, CPS Board Emails

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: 2023: September, CPS Board Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from Jianan Shi, currently CPS Board Member, from Septebmer 1, 2023 through September 30, 2023.

1. Please search all of his CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.communication:

10/16/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR153203 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014348-101223 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014348-101223
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
November 9, 2023 Miriam Bhimani 153203-97206150@requests.muckrock.com 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014348-101223 
Dear Ms. Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: A log of all emails to/from Jianan Shi, currently CPS Board Member, from Septebmer 1, 2023 through September 30, 2023. 

1. Please search all of his CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment. RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including personal email addresses, parents’ names, employee identification numbers, medical information, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Personally identifiable student record information has been redacted in accordance with the Illinois School Student Records Act 105 ILCS 10/1 et seq. and the corresponding Section 7.5(r) FOIA exemption (5 ILCS 140/7.5(r)). Please note these invoices have been redacted in accordance with section 7(1)(m) of the FOIA to remove information constituting privileged attorney-client work product. Section 7(1)(m) of the FOIA exempts from release “[c]ommunications between a public body and an attorney [] representing the public body that would not be subject to discovery in litigation, and materials prepared or compiled by or for a public body in anticipation of a criminal, civil, or administrative proceeding upon the request of an attorney advising the public body.” 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(m). Further, certain records are exempt from release pursuant to Section 7.5(h) of the FOIA, which exempts from disclosure “information the disclosure of which is exempted under the State Officials and Employees Ethics Act, and records of any lawfully created State or local inspector general’s office that would be exempt if created or obtained by an Executive Inspector General’s office.” 5 ILCS 140/7.5(h). To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. If you have any questions, please contact our office at (773) 553-3500. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Annie Righi Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: Institutional Press Policies (Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College)

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Institutional Press Policies (Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anne Marie Tamburro

title: Israel/Hamas Public Uni Response -  Bellevue College

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Israel/Hamas Public Uni Response -  Bellevue College
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

— Any emails, including any attachments to said emails, to or from President David May, Acting Vice President Rodger Harrison, Director of Public Safety Ross Villegas, Director of Marking and Communications Anna Sherwood, from October 8, 2023 to October 11, 2023 that mention “Israel,” “Gaza,” “Hamas,” “Palestine,” “Palestinian,” ""Students for Justice in Palestine,"" “SJP,” “Chabad,” or “HIllel.”

This FOI request is being filed in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story. Therefore, I ask that my request is expedited. When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released. I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method, and again, please release documents on a rolling basis, as they become available. 

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Also, I am a member of the news media as a reporter for Business Insider, and the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. If fees associated with this request will be in excess of $25, kindly notify me in advance of fulfilling this request. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me if you have questions regarding this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Beckler

title: CCRB files of NYPD officers

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: CCRB files of NYPD officers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The full and entire Civilian Complaint Review Board ("CCRB") file, including without limitation any and all documents describing: 
A. Substantiated complaints;
B. Unsubstantiated complaints; 
C. Allegations or informal or formal charges;
D. Investigation, including without limitation any and all interview transcripts, audio, video, or notes and any photos or videos of an alleged incident; 
E. CCRB proceedings, including without limitation transcripts and exhibits;
F. Findings, statements, opinions, transcripts, or any other document created by any NYPD agencies, district attorney offices, or courts;
G. Correspondence, including without limitation any and all correspondence with the subject officer, any other officers, any victims or complainants, any other witnesses, and any district attorney's office;
H. Findings, including without limitation reports or memoranda or opinions of factual findings, dispositions, or analysis of conduct;
I. Recommendations for discipline; and
J. Discipline;

For the following New York Police Department ("NYPD") officers:
A. Daniel Pantaleo
B. Darryl Schwartz
C. Ronald Hobson
D. Vincent D'Andraia 
E. Edward McClain
F. John Zorilla (shield #22991)
G. Miguel Frias (shield #1309)
H. Robert Jaquez
I. Maurice Harrington (shield #6286)
J. Ramon Castro
K. Brandon Gembecki (shield #1517)
L. Michael Cautillo
M. Jamel Watson

I am happy to accept each officer's file separately, should some files be available for production earlier than others.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Avinash Samarth

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2020-054-00132 Extended
communications.communication:
The Civilian Complaint Review Board (CCRB) has extended the time to respond to your FOIL request FOIL-2020-054-00132 for the following reasons: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2020-054-00132) You can expect a response on or about Wednesday, March 17, 2021.

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2020-054-00132 Closed
communications.communication:
The Civilian Complaint Review Board (CCRB) has closed your FOIL request FOIL-2020-054-00132 for the following reasons: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2020-054-00132) 
 Your request under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) is denied in part and granted in part for the reasons stated below. As per our previous correspondence, I am considering your request fulfilled by the provided closing reports, which were redacted pursuant to FOIL. 
The CCRB closing report does not represent the final agency determination of the Board; it is merely a recommendation by the investigator to the Board. Public Officers Law § 87(2)(g)(iii) permits the CCRB to deny access to records that are “inter-agency or intra-agency materials which are not . . . final agency policy or determinations.”  Accordingly, we do not disclose CCRB work product, opinions, recommendations, advice, or records which reflect the consultative and deliberative process. Such records were redacted because they do not constitute final agency determinations. 
Additionally, these reports contain information, such as names, addresses, ages, and dates of birth, and other personal identifying information as defined in Public Officers Law § 89. As a City agency, we are also subject to N.Y.C. Admin. Code § 23-1201 and are required to withhold personal identifying information to the extent permitted under FOIL. Public Officers Law § 87(2)(b) permits the CCRB to deny access to records or information that “if disclosed would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.” Such personal identifying information has been redacted. 
NYS Office of Court Administration records are exempt from FOIL under Public Officers Law §§ 86(1), 86(3), and 86(4), which define "judiciary," "agency," and "record" and state that records from agencies that are identified as judiciary are exempt from FOIL. Additionally, the CCRB has a contract with the Office of Court Administration that conditions our ability to access their records, a necessity for our investigations, on not releasing those records except as proscribed by the contract. So as to not interfere with the contract the CCRB has with the New York State Officer of Court Administration as permitted under Public Officers Law § 87(2)(c) and to comply with the defined terms of FOIL, any information obtained from the search of the Office of Court Administration’s database have been redacted. 
Other redactions, such as those based on Public Officers Law §§ 87(2)(a) ("specifically exempted from disclosure by state or federal statute”), 87(2)(e) (law enforcement and investigative records), 87(2)(f) (life and safety), and 87(4-b) (technical infractions) are noted as applicable within the reports. 
 
You may appeal the decision to deny access to material that was redacted in part or withheld in entirety by contacting the agency's FOIL Appeals Officer: foil@ccrb.nyc.gov within 30 days. (mailto:foil@ccrb.nyc.gov?subject=FOIL-2020-054-00132%20-%20Appeal)

title: Evergreen Public Schools - KPIs

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Evergreen Public Schools - KPIs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All key performance indicators (KPIs) tracked within the school district including but not limited to all KPIs related to the EPS Strategic Plan Strategic Plan.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lyonell D. Keplar

communications.communication: I have not received a response to this public records request within the five days as provided by law, when might I expect a response?

communications.subject: RE: Fax Received from CSID: +17249461484  -  Pages received: 2
communications.communication:
Mr. Keplar,

In response to your November 1, 2023 public records request for:

"All key performance indicators (KPIs) tracked within the school district including but not limited to all KPIs related to the EPS Strategic Plan Strategic Plan."

The District's Strategic Plan is linked here<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1i_528CnYIBjEvcYlYpc7EjTVkDTv7eqZ/view>. The District spent the previous year solidifying the goals, metrics and outcomes of the Strategic Plan. It's my understanding the focus this year is to identify KPIs. This means the District does not currently have any records responsive to your request.

If you should have any questions or concerns at all about any aspect of our processing of your public records request, please let me know. Still while welcoming such contact by you, the Public Records Act advises I should notify you that, by my delivery of this email to you, our School District considers your request closed. So please know that we do now consider your request as having been closed.

Thank you,

Eliza Cornelison
Paralegal | Human Resources
Evergreen Public Schools
360-604-4049 | eliza.cornelison@evergreenps.org<mailto:eliza.cornelison@evergreenps.org>

communications.communication:

Records that contain *counts* of Use of Force for all CDCR facilities from January 1, 2021,through June 30, 2023, disaggregated by

a) date of incident or report,

Sincerely,

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

John Lindsay-Poland

Data Concierge Service - C012617-091023  CDCR takes every allegation of employee misconduct very seriously and has restructured its process to ensure complaints are properly, fairly and thoroughly reviewed. 
In January 2022, CDCR implemented emergency regulations to improve the investigations process on staff misconduct allegations, and the department received funding in the 2022-23 state budget to support these continued efforts. A system of fixed and body-worn camera use is in place. In September 2022, CDCR announced changes to employee discipline for misconduct directed at inmates, parolees, other employees, or members of the public. 
We have a Frequently Asked Questions webpage available here that explains the changes and regulations process: https://www.cdcr.ca.gov/family-resources/frequently-asked-questions-on-allegations-of-staff-misconduct/.

Sincerely, 

Kayla Ronzone

title: Conficker - FBI

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Conficker - FBI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Investigative records FBI may be holding on the "Conficker" (Also refered to as 'downadup', 'downup' or 'kido') worm from 2008. This worm impacted hundreds of thousands of internet hosts when it was first released, and continues to impact internet services even today.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emily Crose

foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1450436-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: FBI files on Lawrence Ferlinghetti

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI files on Lawrence Ferlinghetti
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- all files, including cross-referenced records and ELSUR documents, regarding American poet Lawrence Monsanto Ferlinghetti (March 24, 1919 - Feb. 22, 2021). Proof of death is not required, as his death has been widely reported: https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/obituaries/lawrence-ferlinghetti-dead/2021/02/23/37b2a134-edd5-11df-abf5-a1622994c5f5_story.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    CJ Ciaramella
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ffbi-files-on-lawrence-ferlinghetti-108836%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2O3FGiSDXH3mORgxvQEAgVs%3A1lElhX%3A0MX5glPniDXWiVdGlpq5MCG5mjM

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Bruceville Eddy, Texas Police Department Chief Dorsey

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Bruceville Eddy, Texas Police Department Chief Dorsey
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copy of letter or notes, or emails from a Jan Grice, James Grice, James R. Grice or "Jan" Grice, or Jan G. Copies also of the envelope. All results of closed investigation into identity of "Jan Grice". Copies of ALL Jan or Jan G letters to all City Council members and Mayor. Copy of file from already resolved so thereby Open Records the Unemployment Hearing notes, letters, files, audio tapes, and video tapes from termination of Justin Richardson. Any reference to Bernadette or Berni Feazell in any correspondence concerning said firing, or reprimand.  Emails, letters, notes from converences, or audio tapes of any meetings between Chief Dorsey and Chris Eubanks, this includes phone calls about Berni Feazell and/or Justin Richardson. Any in person meetings?  Letters to the Bruceville Police department from Justin Richardson, or to Justin Richardson, and/or about Justin Richardson. Receipts of any meetings between Chief Dorsey, or any officer and Chris Eubank in person. Any and all meetings with City Attorney or City Manager about firing Justin Richardson for his blog or hanging out with Bernadette Feazell. Any investigation into Bernadette Feazell, including ordering of criminal records, or asking Chris Eubank or anyone in Law Enforcement. Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

Open Records Request Received on 10/26/2023.
Current Status of Request: Further Response Coming.

title: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the Al Otro Lado #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative, we respectfully request all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. Specifically, we seek emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/brazilian-man-ice-custody-passes-away-new-mexico-hospital?s=09
and here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/nicaraguan-man-ice-custody-passes-away-colorado-hospital

By definition, the information requested cannot be subject to withholding under Exemption 7A (open investigations), because ICE has already released its core facts publicly.

We seek expedited processing of this request under 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), and make the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 in support thereof: 
1. Both the Torrance in-custody death and the Aurora in-custody death have been met with calls from elected Representatives and Senators for vigorous investigation, based on each facility's documented track record. See https://www.heinrich.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/heinrich-leads-request-for-immediate-action-from-ice-to-address-inhumane-unsafe-conditions-for-migrants-at-the-torrance-county-detention-facility and https://crow.house.gov/sites/evo-subsites/crow.house.gov/files/evo-media-document/2022.10.21-final-icedhs-letter_0.pdf. 

2. Both deaths have been the subject of widespread and sustained media attention. 
For Torrance: 
https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/22/us/politics/aclu-ice-immigration-detention.html
https://sourcenm.com/2022/09/01/brazilian-asylum-seeker-who-died-by-suicide-held-in-horrific-conditions-attorneys-say/
https://nmpoliticalreport.com/2022/08/31/immigrant-advocacy-organizations-seeking-answers-around-brazilian-mans-death-by-suicide-while-in-ice-custody/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/10/18/headlines/asylum_seekers_at_torrance_ice_jail_claim_retaliation_over_hunger_strike
https://theappeal.org/torrance-detention-center-kesley-vial-brazil/
https://www.santafenewmexican.com/opinion/letters_to_editor/close-torrance-county-ice-facility-now/article_08a7cf58-5705-11ed-b432-1bb650ab5a32.html
https://www.krqe.com/news/crime/man-commits-suicide-in-ice-custody-in-torrance-county/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/8/29/headlines/asylum_seeker_dies_by_suicide_at_for_profit_ice_jail_in_new_mexico
https://www.abqjournal.com/2528527/webhedline-126.html
https://www.lcsun-news.com/story/news/local/new-mexico/2022/09/30/groups-retaliation-after-migrants-report-torrance-county-detention-center/69530415007/

For Aurora: 
https://www.cpr.org/2022/10/27/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-investigation-into-death-at-aurora-ice-facility/
https://www.cpr.org/2022/11/03/advocates-immigration-customs-enforcement-custody-death/
https://www.9news.com/article/news/local/man-nicaragua-dies-aurora-ice-facility/73-f52d0d45-531c-4e17-a361-1376d887e499
https://www.denver7.com/news/local-news/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-probe-after-detainees-death-at-aurora-ice-facility
https://www.cbsnews.com/colorado/news/melvin-ariel-calero-mendoza-nicaraguan-father-dies-ice-custody-aurora-facility/
https://www.longmontleader.com/local-news/el-comite-wants-answers-to-ice-detention-death-5990654
https://news.yahoo.com/video/nicaraguan-father-two-dies-ice-040542382.html
https://www.newsbreak.com/news/2810691040469/report-details-what-led-up-to-man-s-death-in-aurora-ice-custody

3. In both cases, serious questions have been raised by elected officials as to the circumstances surrounding each person's death, and ICE and its contractors' compliance with mandatory duties surrounding care of detained immigrants. 

Therefore, the requirements of 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) are satisfied, and expedited processing is proper. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this important request, and your response within the statutorily required 10-calendar day period! 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
12/21/2022Andrew FreeMuckRock News, DEPT MR136588Boston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462        Dear Requester:This acknowledges receipt of your 11/8/2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. .  Your request was received in this office on 11/8/2022.After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is 1) too broad in scope, 2) did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking, or 3) only posed questions to the agency.  Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  For this reason, §5.3(b) of the DHS regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort.  Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the ICE program office you believe created and/or controls the record.  The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records.  Please resubmit your request containing a reasonable description of the records you are seeking.  Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request.If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.  Please be advised that this action is not a denial of your request and will not preclude you from filing other requests in the future. If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Marcus Francis at (866) 633-1182 or the address above.Your request has been assigned reference number 2023-ICFO-03462. Sincerely,ICE-FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
We appeal the agency’s determination that the request is improper. 

It seeks:

“emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted [on ICE’s website].”

We seek expedited processing of this request for the reasons described in our original submission. 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

Your appeal, postmarked or electronically transmitted on 12/23/2022, was received on 1/5/2023.The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2023-ICAP-00243 for tracking purposes. I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 8, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #2023-ICAP-00243.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You have reached SecureRelease Support.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).

SecureRelease website support staff are not involved with the processing or prioritization of requests, and this inbox is not monitored by agency personnel.

According to our records, request 2023-ICAP-00243 was not submitted through the SecureRelease Request Portal, therefore, we are unable to provide online status tracking or portal messaging capabilities for this request.

We have CC’ed the ICE FOIA inbox for visibility. To follow up further on this request, please refer to communications you received from the agency for contact instructions or reach out to the agency in the same manner that you submitted your request.

Regards,

SecureRelease™ Support Team
securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com<mailto:securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com>
www.securerelease.us<http://www.securerelease.us>

title: Request for ZEEVIC Work Group Meeting Records

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for ZEEVIC Work Group Meeting Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking access to records related to the Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council (ZEEVIC) Work Group meetings held since July 1, 2023. These records include agendas, lists of attendees, and meeting notes as well as any other related records. I am interested in records from both the ZEV Policy Scorecard Work Group and the Trucking MHDV Infrastructure Work Group meetings, as well as any other ZEEVIC Work Group meetings that have been held. I am also seeking any records announcing the Work Group meetings as well as any communications inviting attendees or potential attendees. 

If all or any part of this request is denied, I request that I be provided with a written explanation that includes the reason for the denial, the legal authority justifying the denial, and my appeal rights. If you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the portions that can be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lanny Hartmann

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request #854784
communications.communication:
Thank you for your prompt response to my Public Information Act (PIA) request and for providing me with the estimated cost for fulfilling the original request. In light of the associated cost and to expedite the process, I would like to refine my request as follows:

I am now specifically interested in obtaining information related to the Zero Emission Vehicle (ZEV) Policy Scorecard working group and the Trucking Medium and Heavy-Duty Vehicle (MHDV) Infrastructure working group. More specifically, I am seeking a list of the ZEEVIC members appointed to each of these working groups by the Chair, as prescribed in the ZEEVIC Procedures.

Given the nature of this more targeted request, I believe it will take less than two hours of work to fulfill. Therefore, I anticipate that there should be no additional cost associated with this revised request.

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to receiving the revised information at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,

Lanny Hartmann

title: Ambulance Incident 6-6-22

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ambulance Incident 6-6-22
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Non-exempt audio, video (including body-worn camera, in-car "dash cam", surveillance video, etc), and written reports compiled or obtained by your department related to the response and investigation into the incident below.

Incident: 6/6/22, woman jumps from ambulance and is seriously injured. Location was in the 4200 block of Amelia Olive Branch Road. For reference: https://www.fox19.com/2022/06/07/woman-jumps-ambulance-gets-stuck-under-it-clermont-county-dispatchers-say/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Patrick Wells

title: Washington Public Records Act Request: Tuberculosis case notification data and related policies, 2000-2022

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington Public Records Act Request: Tuberculosis case notification data and related policies, 2000-2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:


*  Records of TB case notifications in all Washington state prisons, with day and institution of notification for each case from January 2020-July 2022.
* Records of date of TB treatment initiation for all notified cases.
* Records ofTB treatment outcomes for all notified cases. 
* Records of number of and location of incarcerated individuals offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested and date of testing.
* Records of TB case notifications in all Washington state prisons for corrections officers in all WA state prisons, with day and institution of notification for each case from January 2020-July 2022.
* Records of number of and location of corrections officers offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested.
* Any and all WDOC policies and procedures regarding TB prevention and control measures put in place in prisons.
* Records of movements of incarcerated individuals from or to any of the prisons reporting TB cases from January 2020-July 2022, including the number of individuals transferred, date of transfer, reason of transfer, origin prison, and destination prison.

For all items, we are requesting de-identified records.


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Further, we respectfully request a waiver of these fees as we are affiliated with a research institution, and this request is made for a scholarly or scientific purpose and not for a commercial use. We would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katharine Walter

communications.subject: Public Records Request, P-29139
communications.communication:
Ms. Walter:

I acknowledge receipt of your public records request dated July 18, 2022 and received in our office on July 19, 2022. We have assigned this request a tracking number of P-29139.  Please reference this number in all future communications regarding this request.

You state your request to be for the following records:

1.      Records of TB case notifications in all Washington state prisons, with day and institution of notification for each case from January 2020‐July 2022
2.      Records of date of TB treatment initiation for all notified cases
3.      Records of TB treatment outcomes for all notified cases
4.      Records of number of and location of incarcerated individuals offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested and date of testing
5.      Records of TB case notifications in all Washington state prisons for corrections officers in all WA state prisons, with day and institution of notification for each case from January 2020‐July 2022
6.      Records of number of and location of corrections officers offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested
7.      Any and all WDOC policies and procedures regarding TB prevention and control measures put in place in prisons
8.      Records of movements of incarcerated individuals from or to any of the prisons reporting TB cases from January 2020‐July 2022, including the number of individuals transferred, date of transfer, reason of transfer, origin prison, and destination prison

I interpret your request to be for disclosure of the following records:

1.      Records showing TB case notifications from the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19, 2022 (the date your request was received) in all Washington state prisons, including date and facility location
2.      Records showing date of TB treatment initiation for all notified cases
3.      Records showing all TB treatment outcomes for all notified cases
4.      Records showing number of, and facility location of incarcerated individuals offered TB testing including number of individuals who were tested and date of testing
5.      Records showing TB case notifications from the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19, 2022 (the date your request was received) in all Washington state prisons for corrections officers in all Washington state prisons, including date and facility location
6.      Records showing number of, and facility location of corrections officers offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested
7.      Any and all current g Washington State Department of Corrections policies and procedures regarding TB prevention and control measures put in place in prisons
8.      Records showing movements of incarcerated individuals from or to any of the prison facilities reporting TB cases during the time frame of January 1, 2020 to July 19 2022, (the date your request was received) including the number of individuals transferred, date of transfer, reason for transfer, origin facility, and receiving facility

I will begin by determining what if any of this information exists outside of confidential individual health records and gather what is available outside of these protected records.   I anticipate being able to provide you an installment of records within 46 business days, on or before August 29, 2022. If you have any questions in the interim, please contact me at tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov<mailto:tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov>.

Sincerely,

Tonja Monroe, Public Records Specialist
Public Records Unit
Washington State Department of Corrections
PO Box 41118
Olympia WA 98504-1118

communications.subject: Public Records Request P-29139, Installment 4
communications.communication:
Ms. Walter:

This e-mail is in follow-up to my last correspondence to you, dated January 19, 2023, regarding your public records request, P-29139.  You requested the following records:

1.      Records showing TB case notifications from the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19, 2022 (the date your request was received) in all Washington state prisons, including date and facility location
2.      Records showing date of TB treatment initiation for all notified cases
3.      Records showing all TB treatment outcomes for all notified cases
4.      Records showing number of, and facility location of incarcerated individuals offered TB testing including number of individuals who were tested and date of testing
5.      Records showing TB case notifications from the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19, 2022 (the date your request was received) in all Washington state prisons for corrections officers in all Washington state prisons, including date and facility location
6.      Records showing number of, and facility location of corrections officers offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested
7.      Any and all current Washington State Department of Corrections policies and procedures regarding TB prevention and control measures put in place in prisons
8.      Records showing movements of incarcerated individuals from or to any of the prison facilities reporting TB cases during the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19 2022, (the date your request was received) including the number of individuals transferred, date of transfer, reason for transfer, origin facility, and receiving facility

I have attached a 4th and final installment of records (2 pages) consisting of records responsive to items 5 & 6 of your request. These documents are provided to you in accordance with the Public Records Act.  By providing you these documents and/or information, the Department is not responsible for your use of this information or for any claims or liabilities that may result from your use or further dissemination.

The file for P-29139 is now closed.  If you should have any questions related to this request, you may contact me at tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov<mailto:tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov>.

Sincerely,

Tonja Monroe
Public Records Specialist
Department of Corrections | Public Records Unit
P.O. Box 41118 | Olympia, WA  98504-1118

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P-29139
communications.communication:
Dear all,

Thank you for your latest installment. Would you please clarify what the two tables (items 5 and 6) include? Is item 5 the number of positive skin tests among correctional officers? Were these unique tests or unique individuals? If the former, would you please indicate as well the number of individuals who had been ever tested and the number of individuals who had at least one positive skin test? 

For item 6, is this the number of individuals tested? Would you please stratify this by time period so that we can determine rate of skin test positivity? 

Thank you for your help. We look forward to your response. 

Sincerely,
Katharine Walter

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P-29139
communications.communication:
Ms. Walter,
I am emailing in response to your correspondence dated November 3, 2023. You ask for clarification on the tables sent in response to items 5 and 6 of your public records request P-29139.
Table 5 shows TB case notifications for corrections officers from the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19, 2022, in all Washington state prisons.
Table 6 shows TB tests given to all staff at facilities during the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19, 2022.
If you should have any additional questions related to this request, you may contact me at tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov<mailto:tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov>.

Sincerely,

Tonja Monroe
Public Records Specialist
Department of Corrections | Public Records Unit
P.O. Box 41118 | Olympia, WA  98504-1118
